title: Abdullah of Saudi Arabia - Wikipedia
snippet: Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Al Saud (1 August 1924 – 23 January 2015) was King and Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia from 1 August 2005 until his death in 2015. Prior to his accession, he was Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia from 13 June 1982.

title: Abdullah of Saudi Arabia | King, Biography, History, & Facts | Britannica
snippet: Abdullah was the de facto ruler of Saudi Arabia from 1995 to 2015 and ruled formally as king after the death of his half-brother King Fahd in 2005.

title: Abdullah of Saudi Arabia facts for kids
snippet: Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Al Saud (born 1 August 1924 – died 23 January 2015) was the King and Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia from 2005 until his death in 2015. Before becoming king, he was the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia starting in 1982.

title: King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia obituary | Saudi Arabia | The Guardian
snippet: Crown prince under the rule of Fahd (1982-2005), Abdullah became de facto ruler in 1995, following Fahd’s prolonged illness, and king in August 2005. His main challenge was to rule amid an ageing group of powerful princes, each desperate to occupy the throne. Under Abdullah, Saudi Arabia degenerated into multiple fiefdoms with each senior prince striving to exercise authority at the expense of the others.

title: A King's Biography | King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Biography Center
